intro: Ficaria chrysocephala, commonly known as the golden crown or yellow star, is a striking member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that resemble small stars. The plant features palmate leaves with a smooth, waxy surface, and it produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow cyathia. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Ficaria chrysocephala is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its unique and colorful appearance.
